replies.author: lsiepel

replies.bodyText: openHAB has a ThingStatusInfoEvent which is triggered when the status is updated. And it has a ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent when the status changes. By only updating when status is changed it effectively eliminates the use case of the ThingStatusInfoEvent. So it should not block updating when only changing.

replies.bodyText: Yes this is a bit vague 😄 . What I meant, if I read it correctly, is that if the bridge is offline the bridge will set the childhandlers offline. However when offline you still might want to set the channels to something like undef. Because otherwise the channels will keep showing the last value, and than the user might not see somethings is not right by just looking at the values.  Also it can be helpful to set a thing offline when there is a except. But than if there is new data and it's all ok again the thing has to be set online again.
replies.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText: If bindings should set all channels to UnDefType.UNDEF when the bridge goes offline, shouldn't that be the default behavior of bridgeStatusChanged?
